meta.appropriation_name: Research, Development, Test & Evaluation, Air Force

AppropriationName.val: Research, Development, Test & Evaluation, Air Force

ProgramElementNote.val: In FY12, this effort was funded under PE 0101127F, project 676023.

ProgramElementMissionDescription.val:
DMS-M is the #1 priority modification program in the B-2 program office.  The B-2 Defensive Management System Modernization (DMS-M) program maintains the B-2 direct attack capability while addressing emerging 21st century threats. DMS-M will upgrade the Electronic Support Measures, antennas, and display processing units.  Modernization of this system will resolve the #1 obsolescence issue in the B-2 fleet.

The B-2 DMS-M will provide the Joint Force Commander and the B-2 fleet with advanced situational awareness, improved supportability, enhanced lethality, increased platform survivability, and networked battlespace awareness. The DMS-M upgrade will provide the following core capabilities for the B-2 and joint warfighting force:  

1) Ability to provide indication, type, and position of airborne and ground-based radio frequency (RF) threats with the situational awareness needed to avoid, engage, or negate threats,

2) Improved RF threat information that can be reported to control agencies or inter-flight for improved situation/battlespace awareness,

3) Ability to adequately control, process, and display incoming threat information to the aircrew and provide updated battle-space awareness,
 
4) Improved supportability and reduced operations and maintenance costs.


BA5 - This program is in Budget Activity 5, Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD, formerly known as System Development and Demonstration (SDD).)  It is expected to pass Milestone B and begin conducting Engineering and Manufacturing Development tasks in FY14 aimed at meeting validated requirements prior to Full Rate Production.

SummaryExplanation.val: FY14 adjusted to match the approved Service Cost Position (SCP).

ProjectNote.val: In FY12, this effort was funded under PE 0101127F, project 676023.

ProjectMissionDescription.val:
DMS-M is the #1 priority modification program in the B-2 program office.  The B-2 Defensive Management System Modernization (DMS-M) program maintains the B-2 direct attack capability while addressing emerging 21st century threats. DMS-M will upgrade the Electronic Support Measures, antennas, and display processing units.  Modernization of this system will resolve the #1 obsolescence issue in the B-2 fleet.

The B-2 DMS-M will provide the Joint Force Commander and the B-2 fleet with advanced situational awareness, improved supportability, enhanced lethality, increased platform survivability, and networked battlespace awareness. The DMS-M upgrade will provide the following core capabilities for the B-2 and joint warfighting force:  

1) Ability to provide indication, type, and position of airborne and ground-based radio frequency (RF) threats with the situational awareness needed to avoid, engage, or negate threats,

2) Improved RF threat information that can be reported to control agencies or inter-flight for improved situation/battlespace awareness,

3) Ability to adequately control, process, and display incoming threat information to the aircrew and provide updated battle-space awareness,
 
4) Improved supportability and reduced operations and maintenance costs.


BA5 - This program is in Budget Activity 5, Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD, formerly known as System Development and Demonstration (SDD).)  It is expected to pass Milestone B and begin conducting Engineering and Manufacturing Development tasks in FY14 aimed at meeting validated requirements prior to Full Rate Production.

Title.val: B-2 Defensive Management System Modernization (DMS-M) Tech Development Ph 1

Description.val: Refine DMS-M system concept.  Begin avionics and Electronic Support Measures (ESM) hardware/software development.  Conduct display processor and antenna competitions.  Initiate rapid acquisition risk reduction efforts  to accelerate program schedule.

Text.val: In FY12, this effort was funded under PE 0101127F, project 676023.
Complete delivery and install of CEESIM and long-lead developmental hardware supporting TD Phase 2 and EMD.

Title.val: B-2 Defensive Management System Modernization (DMS-M) Tech Development Ph 2

Description.val: Continue hardware and software development from Phase 1.  Conduct Preliminary Design Review (PDR) and Milestone B review in FY14.  Initiate required upgrades for Mission Planning System (MPS) software and Trainers (hardware & software).

Text.val: In FY12, this effort was funded under PE 0101127F, project 676023.

Continue software development and hardware integration.  Conduct supplier PDRs.  Initiate purchase of long-lead hardware to support early flight testing in EMD phase.  Initiate contracts for MPS (software) and Trainer (hardware/software) upgrade development.
Complete technology development.  Conduct system PDR and Milestone B.  Monitor long-lead hardware purchases to support EMD.  Continue MPS and Trainer development activities.

Title.val: B-2 Defensive Management System Modernization (DMS-M) Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD)

Description.val: Conduct Critical Design Review (CDR).  Complete hardware/software development, final hardware/software integration, and test activities.  Complete development and provide MPS software upgrade and initial Training System upgrades to support flight test.

Text.val: Conduct array-level demonstration of antennas.  Continue hardware/software development/integration.  Prepare for  CDR in 1QFY15.  Continue MPS software and Training System software/hardware development.

AcquisitionStrategy.val: Key elements of the overall acquisition strategy include: use of sole source contract with a prime/integrating contractor (Northrop Grumman) who will perform subsystem and component competitions where appropriate, use of cost plus incentive fee (CPIF) development contracts, and the combination of developmental upgrades with software sustainment blocks to minimize the number of software releases, aircraft downtime, and differences in fielded configurations.

PerformanceMetrics.val: Please refer to the Performance Base Budget Overview Book for information on how Air Force resources are applied and how those resources are contributing to Air Force performance goals and most importantly, how they contribute to our mission.

Remarks.val:
In FY12, this effort was funded under PE 0101127F, project 676023.

Northrop-Grumman, the prime contractor for the B-2 weapon system, is the integrator and major contractor for B-2 DMS activities.
